intro: Epipactis helleborine subsp. moratoria, commonly known as the Moratorium Helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and a distinctive, showy inflorescence with greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a perennial species that produces a single, erect stem bearing several flowers. The subspecies is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in certain ecological interactions.
